author: Abc Gold Coast
title: Mysterious hexafoil markings in Australian homes point to hidden magical past - ABC News (Australian Broadcasting Corporation)
text:
Map: Boulia 4829 
Markings found etched in historic Australian homes could indicate the presence of magical practices brought by the early British colonials. 
Circular scratchings in wood and rock designed to ward-off evil spirits, known as hexafoils, have been found in houses dating back to the first fleet. 
A researcher into the lost and secret history of folk magic in Australia, Ian Evans, has completed a doctorate on objects deliberately hidden in houses . 
But he felt there was still more to discover about the markings. 
"It turns out the shoes and garments and concealed objects were just a part of the whole panorama of magic in Australia," he said. 
Now he is turning his attention to these patterns which are found throughout the world. Taking comfort in superstitions 
Superstition and magic were ways for newcomers to make sense of this strange new land, full of natural hazards and dangerous convicts and bushrangers. External Link: Deborah Harkness hexafoil 
"We thought that people who came to Australia left all their funny ideas on the wharfs in London," Dr Evans said. 
"They brought a lot of stuff as part of their cultural baggage and the practice of magic was one of those things." 
Dr Evans said the rituals went on in parallel with the practice of formal religion. 
"I think these people went to church on Sundays and they did a little magic when they got home," he said. 
However it was mostly kept under wraps. 
"The problem is these people left no record, there's not a word in the documentary archives about these practices," he said. 
"[It was] top secret, but everyone knew about it." 
Dr Evans hopes to uncover some more of the county's secret history through the hexafoils. 
"I think it's going to cause a little revision in some of the history books of Australia," he said. 
"It's writing a new chapter in the history of Australia because we didn't know these things were going on, we didn't know that our ancestors were highly superstitious and into magic." 
He said there were likely still many more magical mysteries in historic homes waiting to be discovered.
